intro: Lappularia bifrons, commonly known as the two-faced lappularia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia, thriving in cold, rocky environments. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, and its hairy, narrow leaves. It typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Lappularia bifrons is adapted to harsh climates and plays a role in pollination by attracting various insects.
